Differential scanning calorimetry.definition: temperature of the inflexion point on DSC data.

Dynamic mechanical analysis.measurement: storage (G′) and the loss (G″) moduli of the complex shear modulus (G∗) and the loss factor tan(δ) (G″/G′)
Dynamic mechanical analysis.temperature range: 200K to 450K with a heating rate of 1K/min

parameters.main relaxation temperature: Tα is defined here as the temperature where the maximum of tan(δ) is reached.

Electrical conductivity measurements.method: complex admittance Y∗ was recorded versus time. From this admittance, the complex conductivity σ∗ can be deduced.

Transmission electron microscopy.sample preparation: A drop of diluted suspension of MWNTs in ethanol or cellulose nanofibrils in water was deposited on amorphous carbon-coated TEM grids and then observed at room temperature.
